step1.sentence: Looking back on her twenties, she admitted she didn't have regrets about taking risks, only about the chances she never took.

step2.story: After turning down the job offer in Tokyo, Marcus spent months wondering if he had made a mistake. But over time, he realized he didn't have regrets — staying close to family had been the right call. Some choices, he learned, only make sense in hindsight.

step3.story: Elena sat on the porch of her childhood home, watching the sun dip below the hills. She was sixty-two now, and friends often asked whether she had regrets about never pursuing her painting seriously. She would pause, then shake her head slowly. The years spent raising her children, building a quiet life in a small town — none of it felt like a waste. Still, on evenings like this, she would pull out an old sketchbook and let her hand move freely across the page. Having regrets, she decided, was different from wishing things had gone differently; one weighed you down, the other simply reminded you that you still had something left to give.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 후회(regrets)를 가지다(have) — 즉, 과거의 선택이나 행동에 대해 아쉬움이나 후회의 감정을 품고 있다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 삶을 돌아보거나 중요한 결정을 내린 뒤 그 선택에 대한 아쉬움을 표현할 때 사용한다. 'I have no regrets'(후회는 없다)처럼 부정형으로도 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'regret'은 고대 프랑스어 'regreter'(슬퍼하다, 그리워하다)에서 유래했으며, 이후 영어에서 과거의 행동에 대한 후회나 유감을 나타내는 단어로 정착했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 '미안하다(sorry)'고 말하는 것보다 더 깊고 지속적인 감정을 내포한다. 순간적인 실수보다는 삶의 방향이나 중요한 선택에 대한 성찰적 아쉬움을 표현할 때 어울린다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He retired without any regrets, proud of the life he had built.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 자신이 일궈온 삶이 자랑스러워, 아무런 후회 없이 은퇴했다.
